Row.Text: +50% [ICON_Faith] Faith points per Shrine and Temple
Your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade routes with another cities provide +1 [ICON_FOOD] food for you and +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] production for them
Your Spy level is increased by 1 for offensive operations
+ 2 influence points per turn towards earning Envoys.
+10% [ICON_FOOD] Food and [ICON_GOLD] Gold per City-State you are the Suzerain of
Open Borders with all City-States. Enemy Spy level reduced by 1 in your lands.
Your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade routes to an ally's city provide +4 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science for them and +4 [ICON_GOLD] Gold to you. Both parties gain +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture with the trade.
International Trade Routes to other civilizations provide +4 Culture for Portugal, 1 extra diplomacy slot, -50% of war weariness

+15% [ICON_Science] Science in this city. Extra Culture, Science and Production. Generates Grande Explorador and Great Scientist. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]National Wonder. Only one copy of this building may be built in your civilization. May only be built by Caravela Latina Anchored at Porto (with a Estaleiro) and in an adjacent Campus places Escola de Sagres NATIONAL WONDER, Campus must be adjacent to a Cliff.

+30% [ICON_Gold] Gold in this city. Extra Culture, Gold and Production. Generates Great explorer and Great Merchant. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]National Wonder. Only one copy of this building may be built in your civilization. May only be built by Nau anchored at Porto (with a Porto Maritimo) and in an adjacent Commercial Hub places Casa da India NATIONAL WONDER, Commercial Hub must be adjacent to City Center.

+45% [ICON_Faith] Faith in this city. Extra Faith, Culture and Production. Generates Great explorer and Great Prophet. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]National Wonder. Only one copy of this building may be built in your civilization. May only be built by Nau anchored at Porto (with a Porto Maritimo) and in an adjacent Holy Site places Mosteiro dos Gerónimos NATIONAL WONDER, Holy Site must be adjacent to City Center.

Unique Monk Missionary. 120 religious strength. Cannot enter other nations' territory without Open Borders. Has +35 Religious Strength bonus in friendly territory (But not if near cities that follow the Inquisitor's religion).
Increases Science, Culture and even Gold from ventures and trade overboards
Naval Melee units that unlocks at Nautical Science. 35 melee strength and 3 movements.
Replaces Dhow and unlocks at Military Tactics. +10 melee strength and -1 movement.
The teachings from your sea quests and naval tradition have inspired a renewed interest in sea exploring in your realm.

Replace.Text: +25% combat experience for all naval units trained in this city. +1 [ICON_FOOD] Food on all Coast tiles for this city. +1 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route capacity, if this city does not yet have a Market building.
With so many ships leaving of your empire you long to need commecial hubs for the goods gain in exploration
The lessons you have learned from dhows (in middle east to india), caravels (in Europe) and junks (in china) exploration have led to a new way of governing your people.
Let us apply our industrial acumen to your newly-constructed Stock Exchange. Steam-powered naval vessels could rule the seas.

The history of Macau is traced back to the Qin dynasty (221–206 BC), when the region now called Macau came under the jurisdiction of Panyu County, Nanhai Prefecture (modern Guangdong). The first recorded Chinese inhabitants of the area were people seeking refuge in Macau from invading Mongols during the Southern Song. Under the Ming dynasty (1368–1644), fishermen migrated to Macau from Guangdong and Fujian. The Macau native people were Tanka boat people.

Macau did not develop as a major settlement until the Portuguese arrived in the 16th century. In 1513, Jorge Álvares became the first Portuguese to land in China. In 1535, Portuguese traders obtained the rights to anchor ships in Macau's harbours and to carry out trading activities, though not the right to stay onshore. Around 1552–1553, they obtained temporary permission to erect storage sheds onshore, in order to dry out goods drenched by sea water; they soon built rudimentary stone houses around the area now called Nam Van.

In 1557, the Portuguese established a permanent settlement in Macau, paying an annual rent of 500 taels (18.9 kilograms / 41.6 pounds) of silver. The Portuguese continued to pay an annual tribute up to 1863 in order to stay in Macau.

The main Portuguese feitorias were in Goa, Malacca, Ormuz, Ternate, and Macau. They were mainly driven by the trade of gold and slaves on the coast of Guinea, spices in the Indian Ocean, and sugar cane in the New World. They were also used for local triangular trade between several territories, like Goa-Macau-Nagasaki, trading products such as sugar, pepper, coconut, timber, horses, grain, feathers from exotic Indonesian birds, precious stones, silks and porcelain from the East, among many other products. In the Indian Ocean, the trade in Portuguese feitorias was enforced and increased by a merchant ship licensing system: the cartazes.

Row.Text: A district for naval activity in your city. Also removes the [ICON_Movement] Movement penalty for embarking and disembarking to and from this tile. Must be built on Coast or Lake Terrain adjacent to land. +1 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route capacity, if this city does not yet have a Commercial Hub district.
District-based project which provides [ICON_Gold] Gold every turn and [ICON_GreatAdmiral] Great Explorer points once finished.
Harbor Shipping to the Exploration of the New World
District-based project which provides [ICON_Gold] Gold every turn and [ICON_GreatMerchant] Great Merchant points once finished.
Harbor Shipping to the trading Nau do Trato
District-based project which provides [ICON_Culture] Gold every turn and [ICON_GreatArtist] Great Artist points once finished.
Instantly creates a Caravela Latina. Allows all naval units to move over ocean tiles without the normal technology requirement.
Instantly creates a Botafogo with 50% of experience
Instantly creates a Dhow with 25% of experience, and great work of Lessons on the Foundation of the Sea and Navigation.
Instantly creates a Galley with 25% of experience
Forms a Fleet out of a military naval unit.
Accumulate 50% less war weariness than usual.
Grants 1 promotion level and +25% combat experience to a military naval unit.
+85% flanking bonus for all naval units.
Gain 100 [ICON_Gold] Gold (on Standard speed). Military units get +50% rewards for plundering sea [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes.

Provides an envoy with a City-State when you establish a Trade Route. Each International City provides a free trading post. After researching Nautical Science and Exploration, Naval units gain the ability to enter ocean tiles, and can form into fleets or Armadas, respectively.
Mare Clausum Receive +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold for each Feitoria. All Ranged Naval Units receive +1 [ICON_Range] Range and All Naval units Heal at a faster rate.

Portuguese renaissance naval units are able to enter in city states territories regardless of your level of influence with them, start with the 'Volta do mar' ability, which gives +1 [ICON_Movement] movement in open sea, and can be purchased at half price.
Improves all coastal hills with adjacent Luxury. Claims the tile it's on and grants +1 Movement for Naval Units starting their turns next to it. May only be built by the Caravela Latina.

Improves all plain tiles in a coast of a City-State, claiming the tile it's on. Provides extra amenities and gold for each trade route with the city-state, and even more if Portugal is the Sovereign. This improvement provides significant yields in food, production, and gold to its tile. May only be built by Nau.

Provides extra amenities and extra housing but also extra culture and food in its tile and in adjacent ones. Helps to generate great writers, great musisians, great artists and great explorers.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]National District. Only one copy of this district may be built in your civilization. May only be built by Nau Anchored at Porto (with a Porto Maritimo) placing Bairro Alto in hills of that city, having an adjacent City Center, and subsequently Commercial Hub and the Porto.
Feitoria is an establishment for factors or merchants carrying on business in foreign lands.

Unique ranged [ICON_Range] naval unit that unlocks at Cartography. May pillage coastal tiles. Upon moving adjacent to a coastal plain terrain of a city-state, places a Feitoria on it. Anchored at Porto (with Porto Maritimo), adjacent to a commercial hub and subsequently to city center, places Bairro Alto National District in a Hill adjacent to city center. Receives a bonus vs cities and gold when a city is captured within two tiles of a Nau based on the number of luxuries around the City.

Unique ranged [ICON_Range] naval unit that unlocks at Cartography. May pillage coastal tiles. Upon moving adjacent to a coastal plain terrain of a city-state, places a Feitoria on it. Anchored at Porto (with Porto Maritimo), adjacent to a commercial hub and subsequently to city center, places Bairro Alto National District in a Hill adjacent to city center.

Unique ranged [ICON_Range] naval unit that unlocks at Cartography. May pillage coastal tiles. Upon moving adjacent to a coastal plain terrain of a city-state, places a Feitoria on it. Anchored at Porto (with Porto Maritimo), adjacent to a commercial hub and subsequently to city center, places Bairro Alto National District in a Hill adjacent to city center. Also anchored at Porto (with Porto Maritimo), adjacent to a holy site hub and subsequently to city center, places Mosteiros dos Jerónimos National Wonder in Holy Site.

Unique ranged [ICON_Range] naval unit that unlocks at Cartography. May pillage coastal tiles. Upon moving adjacent to a coastal plain terrain of a city-state, places a Feitoria on it. Anchored at Porto (with Porto Maritimo), adjacent to a commercial hub and subsequently to city center, places Bairro Alto National District in a Hill adjacent to city center. Also anchored at Porto (with Porto Maritimo), adjacent to a commercial hub and subsequently to city center, places Casa da India National Wonder in Commercial Hub.
Nau known as blackship to trade with Japan

Replaces Caravel with +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength. Gains additional strength when within two tiles of an embarked Trader Unit, and increases the Combat of adjacent Naval Units by +5 [ICON_Strength].
Portuguese "spitfire" Galleon, strongest war ship at the time, replaces frigate

Replaces great admiral but its a land unit instead with no Embark/Disembark Cost. Like great admirals some build units (Portuguese ones) instantly and other bonus on activation. Aditionally, some make great writings

Replaces Caravel and Unlocks with Exploration. +1 [ICON_Movement] Movement on coast and navigates Ocean Irregardless of the Tech. Upon moving adjacent to an uncrowded Coastal hill with an adjacent Luxury or Resource, places a Padrao on it. Anchored at Porto (with a Estaleiro) and in an adjacent Campus with a subsequent CLIFF, places Escola de Sagres NATIONAL WONDER in Campus.
Portuguese first invented caravel to explore the seas
Great portuguese explorers of the seas for reaching the new world and global trade
